This table stores the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head setups that are 
 available.

rows:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head.

The 
		 Name for the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head.

Total 
		 or aggregate count of Spindles on this Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) 
		 Head.

A 
		 value representing the Unit of Measure used to specify the Spindle 
		 Offsets: 
 0 = Imperial 
 1 = Millimeters

A 
		 comma-delimited string containing spindle data: 
 Format:(spindle_1, X_offset_1, Y_offset_1, 
		 Z_offset_1, face_1.....spindle_n, X_offset_N, Y_offset_N, Z_offset_N, 
		 face_N) 
 
 Face Value Definition: 
 0 = Face (Z-) 
 1 = Top (Y-) 
 2 = Left (X+) 
 3 = Bottom (Y+) 
 4 = Right (X-) 
 5 = Back (Z+)

Allows 
		 for graphical spindle offset to represent drill head correctly 
		 without breaking existing post. Format:(version, num_offsets, 
		 index_a, x_offset_a, y_offset_a, index_b, x_offset_b, y_offset_b,...

This table stores the available Machine Links.

rows:
A 
		 unique number to reference this Link.

The 
		 Machine Type the link applies to: 
 1 = Sheet Saw 
 2 = Sheet Router 
 3 = Part Router/Point-to-Point 
 4 = Part Drill & Dowel 
 5 = Part Chop Saw

Internal 
		 function ID to be called for the link in PCncOut output library.

Description 
		 for the Link displayed in the Machine Catalog.

Optional 
		 VB Script to run after Link. If [ProgramID] = 0, the System will 
		 expect a program script.

Flags 
		 to show the Tool Properties required for the Link: 
 0x001 = Number 
 0x002 = Pen 
 0x004 = Layer 
 0x008 = Feed 
 0x010 = Descent 
 0x020 = Maximum Depth Per Pass 
 0x040=Rotate Clock-Wise 
 0x080=Tool Compensation 
 0x100=Drill Cone Angle 
 0x200=Drill To Shoulder 
 0x400=Spindle Speed 
 0x800=Height Offset ID 
 0x1000=A/B/C-Axis Rotation

A 
		 flag to show extended Machine Properties for this Link: 
 0x01 = Extended DXF Properties 
 0x02 = AlphaCAM Properties

A 
		 flag to show extended Edge Properties for this link: 
 0x01 = Show Horizontal Match Drill 
 0x02 = Show Horizontal Match Dowel 
 0x04 = Show Horizontal Match KD 
 0x08 = Show Horizontal Match Glue 
 0x10 = Show Horizontal Glue Duration Milliseconds 
 0x20 = Show Zone 1-4 
 0x40 = Show Zone 4-1

A 
		 flag to show Output Options for this Link: 
 0x01 = Mirror Parts 
 0x02 = Output All Parts 
 0x04 = Output Broken Lines 
 0x08 = IntelliCAM Nest

Optional display name for 
		 link in different locales

Flags to show material handler 
		 properties for this link: 
 0x01=ImportFile 
 0x02=AutoSyncOnOptimize 
 0x04=OffcutImportFile 
 0x08=AutoMakeImportFileCmd

		 the strip width.

A value representing the 
		 Very Small Part Boundaries Shape:

This table stores Extra information for AlphaCAM Machines.

rows:
Cross-reference 
		 to [Machines].[ID] linking this extra AlphaCAM data to a Machine 
		 setup.

The 
		 name of the AlphaCAM Post.

A 
		 value representing the   Level 
		 at which Safe Rapid moves can take place.

A 
		 value representing the   Level 
		 at which Rapid Moves can take place. This value must be less than 
		 the value set for [SafeRapidZ].

Cross-reference 
		 to [GangDrillHeads].[ID] linking the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) 
		 Head.

A 
		 value representing the   Feed 
		 Rate for Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Boring.

A 
		 value representing the   Spindle 
		 Speed (RPMs) for the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Tools.

A 
		 value representing the Normal Lead Type for the Machine: 
 0 = Tool Plunges 
 1 = Tool Ramps In 
 2 = Tool Ramps in leaving a Tab 
 3 = Onion Skin - Tool Ramps in leaving an 
		 Onion Skin 
 4 = Return Onion Skin - Tool ramps in leaving 
		 an Onion Skin until all Parts have been Outlined and then returns 
		 to remove Onion Skins.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the Tool Compensation is applied 
		 during the Machines Rapid Move.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the Tool Path should have a Roll 
		 Radius Corner rather than an L Corner.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head 
		 should move to the Safe Rapid Level between plunges.

A 
		 value representing the Compensation Type for the Machine: 
 0 = None  The path is Offset to Centerline. 
 1 = Machine  The Path is Offset to Centerline. 
		 Set the Compensation Value in the Machine Control equal to the 
		 original Tool Radius minus the Wear Radius. 
 2 = Tool Radius  The Path represents the 
		 outside of the Part. Set the Compensation Value in Machine Control 
		 equal to actual Tool Radius.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if you want the System to   Save 
		 an AlphaCAM drawing file while processing.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   the 
		 X axis on the Machine is along the Length of the Sheet.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   Z 
		 = 0 at the Spoil Board instead of the top of the Material.

The 
		 File extension for Post output.

A 
		 value representing the 0,0 Point (Reference/Origin) of the Machine: 
 0 = Bottom Left 
 1 = Top Left 
 2 = Top Right 
 3 = Bottom Right

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   X 
		 axis is a positive measurement from the Machines Origin.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Y 
		 axis is positive measurement from the Machines Origin.

A 
		 value representing the Corner the Nest (Pack) should originate 
		 from: 
 0 = Bottom Left 
 1 = Top Left 
 2 = Top Right 
 3 = Bottom Right

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Machine 
		 has X/Y Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head limitations.

A 
		 value   representing the Minimum 
		 allowable X position for the Primary Drill on the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) 
		 Head.

A 
		 value   representing the Maximum 
		 allowable X position for the Primary Drill on the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) 
		 Head.

A 
		 value representing the Minimum allowable Y position for the Primary 
		 Drill on the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head.

A 
		 value representing the Maximum allowable Y position for the Primary 
		 Drill on the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the Machine is   Limited to output Operations 
		 that occur on a cardinal work plane.

A 
		 value representing the Distance to Offset the Tool from the finished 
		 path when Ramping in and out of the Material.

If 
		 operation and tool are not centerline create an additional compensated 
		 path for the pocket

Link 
		 part outlines on a nest as one continuous operations

Maintain 
		 the approach offset to the bottom of the material to ensure a 
		 clean edge on back of the sheet

Allow 6th face output on 
		 a nest. The 6th face pattern would be milled first, then 
		 the sheet would be flipped and the rest of the sheet would be 
		 milled

Set part spacing to outline 
		 tool diameter and allow for a common cut between two parts

Set the maximum distance 
		 a common line path can retrace over an already cut path. A 
		 larger value will reduce the number of rapids in the outline paths

A boolean value set true 
		 to allow retracing around small parts. Setting to false 
		 will increase the number of rapid moves in the output but will 
		 reduce the chance of nicking a small part that has moved

A boolean value set true 
		 to favor part placement to optimize common line cutting over material 
		 utilization

Optimize drill sequence 
		 to minimize the number of spindle configuration changes instead 
		 of the shortest path between holes

Rotate the position of the 
		 6th face trip cuts to accomidate posts that modifiy the machine 
		 point of origin. 0=No Rotation, 1=90, 2=180, 3=270

A boolean value set true 
		 to change the lead type on a spiral pocket from a straight plunge 
		 to a sloping arc

A positive value creates 
		 additional overlap on the bridge of the linked outlines.

A boolean value when set 
		 true will output plunge lead-in/outs for all operations as well 
		 as forcing any tool comp to G41/G42 Tool Center. This is 
		 for posts being used to create output for 3rd party vendors that 
		 only want geometry.

A boolean value when set 
		 true to set the local Y axis on a work plane horizontal (parallel 
		 to the default work plane). If false, the X axis will be 
		 horizontal (parallel to the default work plane).

		 true to make the axis change move in a clockwise direction as 
		 opposed to the default counter-clockwise direction.

A boolean value when set

		 set comp prior to the cut.

content.data:
Cross-reference 
		 to [Machines].[ID] linking this extra AlphaCAM data to a Machine 
		 setup.

The 
		 name of the AlphaCAM Post.

A 
		 value representing the   Level 
		 at which Safe Rapid moves can take place.

A 
		 value representing the   Level 
		 at which Rapid Moves can take place. This value must be less than 
		 the value set for [SafeRapidZ].

Cross-reference 
		 to [GangDrillHeads].[ID] linking the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) 
		 Head.

A 
		 value representing the   Feed 
		 Rate for Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Boring.

A 
		 value representing the   Spindle 
		 Speed (RPMs) for the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Tools.

A 
		 value representing the Normal Lead Type for the Machine:
2 = Tool Ramps in leaving a Tab

3 = Onion Skin - Tool Ramps in leaving an 
		 Onion Skin

4 = Return Onion Skin - Tool ramps in leaving 
		 an Onion Skin until all Parts have been Outlined and then returns 
		 to remove Onion Skins.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the Tool Compensation is applied 
		 during the Machines Rapid Move.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the Tool Path should have a Roll 
		 Radius Corner rather than an L Corner.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head 
		 should move to the Safe Rapid Level between plunges.

A 
		 value representing the Compensation Type for the Machine:
0 = None  The path is Offset to Centerline.

1 = Machine  The Path is Offset to Centerline. 
		 Set the Compensation Value in the Machine Control equal to the 
		 original Tool Radius minus the Wear Radius.

2 = Tool Radius  The Path represents the 
		 outside of the Part. Set the Compensation Value in Machine Control 
		 equal to actual Tool Radius.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if you want the System to   Save 
		 an AlphaCAM drawing file while processing.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   the 
		 X axis on the Machine is along the Length of the Sheet.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if   Z 
		 = 0 at the Spoil Board instead of the top of the Material.

The 
		 File extension for Post output.

A 
		 value representing the 0,0 Point (Reference/Origin) of the Machine:

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   X 
		 axis is a positive measurement from the Machines Origin.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Y 
		 axis is positive measurement from the Machines Origin.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the   Machine 
		 has X/Y Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head limitations.

A 
		 value   representing the Minimum 
		 allowable X position for the Primary Drill on the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) 
		 Head.

A 
		 value   representing the Maximum 
		 allowable X position for the Primary Drill on the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) 
		 Head.

A 
		 value representing the Minimum allowable Y position for the Primary 
		 Drill on the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head.

A 
		 value representing the Maximum allowable Y position for the Primary 
		 Drill on the Gang Drill (Multi-Drill) Head.

A 
		 Boolean value set to true if the Machine is   Limited to output Operations 
		 that occur on a cardinal work plane.

A 
		 value representing the Distance to Offset the Tool from the finished 
		 path when Ramping in and out of the Material.

If 
		 operation and tool are not centerline create an additional compensated 
		 path for the pocket

Link 
		 part outlines on a nest as one continuous operations

Maintain 
		 the approach offset to the bottom of the material to ensure a 
		 clean edge on back of the sheet

Allow 6th face output on 
		 a nest. The 6th face pattern would be milled first, then 
		 the sheet would be flipped and the rest of the sheet would be 
		 milled

Set part spacing to outline 
		 tool diameter and allow for a common cut between two parts

Set the maximum distance 
		 a common line path can retrace over an already cut path. A 
		 larger value will reduce the number of rapids in the outline paths

A boolean value set true 
		 to allow retracing around small parts. Setting to false 
		 will increase the number of rapid moves in the output but will 
		 reduce the chance of nicking a small part that has moved

A boolean value set true 
		 to favor part placement to optimize common line cutting over material 
		 utilization

Optimize drill sequence 
		 to minimize the number of spindle configuration changes instead 
		 of the shortest path between holes

Rotate the position of the 
		 6th face trip cuts to accomidate posts that modifiy the machine 
		 point of origin. 0=No Rotation, 1=90, 2=180, 3=270

A boolean value set true 
		 to change the lead type on a spiral pocket from a straight plunge 
		 to a sloping arc

A positive value creates 
		 additional overlap on the bridge of the linked outlines.

A boolean value when set 
		 true will output plunge lead-in/outs for all operations as well 
		 as forcing any tool comp to G41/G42 Tool Center. This is 
		 for posts being used to create output for 3rd party vendors that 
		 only want geometry.

A boolean value when set 
		 true to set the local Y axis on a work plane horizontal (parallel 
		 to the default work plane). If false, the X axis will be 
		 horizontal (parallel to the default work plane).

A boolean value when set 
		 true to make the axis change move in a clockwise direction as 
		 opposed to the default counter-clockwise direction.

A boolean value when set 
		 true will force an interior open path to be milled centerline. 
		 If false additional moves will be added above material to 
		 set comp prior to the cut.
